body:
I actually run into the same issue with tensorflow based models.

```
zeth@master /t/testtensorflow [1]> sudo mlflow models serve -m /tmp/testtensorflow/mlruns/0/c3537b84a7e040dab20afd655b85af5c/artifacts/model/                                      (mlf-core) 
[sudo] password for zeth: 
2020/08/11 15:10:07 INFO mlflow.models.cli: Selected backend for flavor 'python_function'
2020/08/11 15:10:08 INFO mlflow.pyfunc.backend: === Running command 'source activate mlflow-893cda55aba11fe2f781cd4d9c1bd06f48e8e7c1 1>&2 && gunicorn --timeout=60 -b 127.0.0.1:5000 -w 1 ${GUNICORN_CMD_ARGS} -- mlflow.pyfunc.scoring_server.wsgi:app'
[2020-08-11 15:10:09 +0200] [34248] [INFO] Starting gunicorn 20.0.4
[2020-08-11 15:10:09 +0200] [34248] [INFO] Listening at: http://127.0.0.1:5000 (34248)
[2020-08-11 15:10:09 +0200] [34248] [INFO] Using worker: sync
[2020-08-11 15:10:09 +0200] [34255] [INFO] Booting worker with pid: 34255
[2020-08-11 15:10:10 +0200] [34255] [ERROR] Exception in worker process
Traceback (most recent call last):

    self.load_wsgi()
  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/lib/python3.8/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/base.py", line 144, in load_wsgi

  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/lib/python3.8/site-packages/gunicorn/app/wsgiapp.py", line 39, in load_wsgiapp
    return util.import_app(self.app_uri)
  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/lib/python3.8/site-packages/gunicorn/util.py", line 358, in import_app
    mod = importlib.import_module(module)
  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/lib/python3.8/importlib/__init__.py", line 127, in import_module

  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1014, in _gcd_import

  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 671, in _load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap_external>", line 783, in exec_module
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 219, in _call_with_frames_removed
  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/scoring_server/wsgi.py", line 6, in <module>
    app = scoring_server.init(load_model(os.environ[scoring_server._SERVER_MODEL_PATH]))
  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/__init__.py", line 473, in load_model
    model_impl = importlib.import_module(conf[MAIN])._load_pyfunc(data_path)
  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/keras.py", line 388, in _load_pyfunc
    import tensorflow as tf
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorflow'
[2020-08-11 15:10:10 +0200] [34255] [INFO] Worker exiting (pid: 34255)
[2020-08-11 15:10:10 +0200] [34248] [INFO] Shutting down: Master
[2020-08-11 15:10:10 +0200] [34248] [INFO] Reason: Worker failed to boot.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/bin/mlflow", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(cli())
  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 829, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 782, in main

  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1259, in invoke

  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 610, in invoke

  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/models/cli.py", line 55, in serve
    return _get_flavor_backend(model_uri,
  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/backend.py", line 91, in serve
    return _execute_in_conda_env(conda_env_path, command, self._install_mlflow,
  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/envs/mlf-core/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/backend.py", line 171, in _execute_in_conda_env
    raise Exception("Command '{0}' returned non zero return code. Return code = {1}".format(
Exception: Command 'source activate mlflow-893cda55aba11fe2f781cd4d9c1bd06f48e8e7c1 1>&2 && gunicorn --timeout=60 -b 127.0.0.1:5000 -w 1 ${GUNICORN_CMD_ARGS} -- mlflow.pyfunc.scoring_server.wsgi:app' returned non zero return code. Return code = 3

```

All right, so one actually has to have Pytorch/Tensorflow installed?

This is not documented anywhere (from what I've seen). I expected the conda environment to take care of that?

However, now when serving the tensorflow mode after having installed Tensorflow I get:

```
zeth@master /t/testtensorflow> mlflow models serve -m /tmp/testtensorflow/mlruns/0/c3537b84a7e040dab20afd655b85af5c/artifacts/model/                                               (mlf-core)

2020/08/11 15:15:42 INFO mlflow.pyfunc.backend: === Running command 'source /home/zeth/anaconda3/bin/../etc/profile.d/conda.sh && conda activate mlflow-893cda55aba11fe2f781cd4d9c1bd06f48e8e7c1 1>&2 && gunicorn --timeout=60 -b 127.0.0.1:5000 -w 1 ${GUNICORN_CMD_ARGS} -- mlflow.pyfunc.scoring_server.wsgi:app'

Return code = 3

Is this a new issue that warrants a new issue to be opened?

rename.from: [BUG] mlflow serve pytorch model -> no module named torch
rename.to: [BUG] mlflow serve pytorch/tensorflow model -> no module named torch/tensorflow

body: When attempting to serve a Pytorch model I still run into the same issue from above.
@Zethson Thanks for filing. It looks like the gunicorn process is running in your current environment rather than an environment that `mlflow models serve` creates.
Can you run this command: `conda activate mlflow-893cda55aba11fe2f781cd4d9c1bd06f48e8e7c1`?

As mentioned in the issue description I already activated the environments manually and the libraries are available in those.

Happy to provide more information if required.
I guess you're currently in `mlf-cor`, `mlflow-893cda55aba11fe2f781cd4d9c1bd06f48e8e7c1`.

So for the sake of reproducibility here's a full log:

```
zeth@master /t/exploding_springfield> mlflow run . -P epochs=2 -A gpus=all                                                                                                             (base) 
2020/08/11 16:07:35 INFO mlflow.projects: === Building docker image exploding_springfield ===
2020/08/11 16:07:39 INFO mlflow.projects: === Created directory /tmp/tmphv1f6kon for downloading remote URIs passed to arguments of type 'path' ===
2020/08/11 16:07:39 INFO mlflow.projects: === Running command 'docker run --rm --gpus all -v /tmp/exploding_springfield/mlruns:/mlflow/tmp/mlruns -v /tmp/exploding_springfield/mlruns/0/0f9cd5a1d3c346d3ae5f63a2da2e1be6/artifacts:/tmp/exploding_springfield/mlruns/0/0f9cd5a1d3c346d3ae5f63a2da2e1be6/artifacts -e MLFLOW_RUN_ID=0f9cd5a1d3c346d3ae5f63a2da2e1be6 -e MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=file:///mlflow/tmp/mlruns -e MLFLOW_EXPERIMENT_ID=0 exploding_springfield:latest python exploding_springfield/exploding_springfield.py \
  --cuda True \
  --epochs 2 \
  --general_seed 0 \
  --pytorch_seed 0 \
  --training_batch-size 64 \
  --test-batch-size 1000 \
  --learning-rate 0.01 \
  --log-interval 100
' in run with ID '0f9cd5a1d3c346d3ae5f63a2da2e1be6' === 
Num GPUs Available: 1
Using 1 GPUs!
Downloading http://yann.lecun.com/exdb/mnist/train-images-idx3-ubyte.gz to data/MNIST/raw/train-images-idx3-ubyte.gz
100.1%Extracting data/MNIST/raw/train-images-idx3-ubyte.gz to data/MNIST/raw
Downloading http://yann.lecun.com/exdb/mnist/train-labels-idx1-ubyte.gz to data/MNIST/raw/train-labels-idx1-ubyte.gz

Processing...
/home/user/miniconda/envs/exploding_springfield/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torchvision/datasets/mnist.py:469: UserWarning: The given NumPy array is not writeable, and PyTorch does not support non-writeable tensors. This means you can write to the underlying (supposedly non-writeable) NumPy array using the tensor. You may want to copy the array to protect its data or make it writeable before converting it to a tensor. This type of warning will be suppressed for the rest of this program. (Triggered internally at  /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1595629403081/work/torch/csrc/utils/tensor_numpy.cpp:141.)

So we trained.
Next we try to serve:

```
zeth@master /t/exploding_springfield> mlflow models serve -m /tmp/exploding_springfield/mlruns/0/0f9cd5a1d3c346d3ae5f63a2da2e1be6/artifacts/models/                                    (base)

[2020-08-11 16:09:50 +0200] [42189] [INFO] Starting gunicorn 20.0.4
[2020-08-11 16:09:50 +0200] [42189] [INFO] Listening at: http://127.0.0.1:5000 (42189)
[2020-08-11 16:09:50 +0200] [42189] [INFO] Using worker: sync
[2020-08-11 16:09:50 +0200] [42195] [INFO] Booting worker with pid: 42195

  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/base.py", line 119, in init_process
    self.load_wsgi()
  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/base.py", line 144, in load_wsgi
    self.wsgi = self.app.wsgi()
  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/app/base.py", line 67, in wsgi
    self.callable = self.load()
  File "/home/zeth/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/app/wsgiapp.py", line 49, in load
    return self.load_wsgiapp()
